comments: For n>=4, a(n) is equal to the number of functions f: {1,2,...,n-1}->{1,2,3,4} such that Im(f) contains 3 fixed elements. - Aleksandar M. Janjic and _Milan Janjic_, Feb 27 2007
references: K. S. Immink, Coding Schemes for Multi-Level Channels that are Intrinsically Resistant Against Unknown Gain and/or Offset Using Reference Symbols, http://www.exp-math.uni-essen.de/~immink/pdf/jsac13.pdf, 2013.
links: Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Doug McKenzie mckfam4(AT)aol.com
